But you said you didn't have this problem with any other champion, and neither do I. It could just be a bug, but I'm not sure

Quick question, what was your level? Not sure if it really counts for much but in a 20 minute match... I do usually see high numbers

Sorry if this is quite late but, besides the obligatory "buy illuminate". There is her audio queues, Going stealth- "Come and get me" or "Poof! Haha" Her coming out of stealth results in a loud tone, alerting anyone nearby she is now visible (unless you already bought illuminate) Skye only has 2000 total health, and there are no cards to increase it Skye will usually check the scoreboard for which champion has illuminate, so she can change her playstyle accordingly. For example, Skye knows Lex has illuminate, so if the two get in an inclosed hallway together, Skye will most likely be more aggressive, because she knows she's not unseen anymore Check which talent she's running, her most deadly is Debilitate, for the sole reason it can make her poison bolts very deadly.. combining with her wrist crossbow shots You can hear her footsteps when she's invisible, which usually allows you to access where she is Skye is not very strong in a 2v1, if you're having trouble getting rid of her, try to have a teamate help you Skye's smoke screen creates a circle on the floor, which everyone can see. If you or a teamate has AOE damage, shoot into the circle, she is most likely trying to heal up so it might be an easy kill depending on the situation Try killing her from long range, her only 'range' damage is her poison bolts, her wrist crossbow is very short range If you or a teamate can, try stunning, crippling, or slowing her. This technically applies to all champions, but if Skye gets slowed it can be devastating if she is stuck near a bunch of enimie because she tried to sneak past them (pretty situational) Not sure if this will be too useful, but this is what I find her weaknesses are, if you need too. Just look up her audio queues on YouTube and listen to them a couple times: source, plays Skye a lot

Androxus has a little bit of an edge against Skye personally, he can poke her from range. But i do also stick by the fact if she does get the jump on you, you're probably dead meat. Especially if she shoots her poison bolts. If you're low, and manage to escape, you need your healer immediately because it'll slowly kill you. I do hope you find teamates that aknoledge how much a threat Skye can be, if the team buckles down on her... she can be shut down

Tha-thats.. that's not... that's not how it works.. During an emergency, you call 911. You stay on the line with them, and tell them your problem, and they send out units accordingly. They seriously don't just say "Oh welp, yeah um. She'll die anyways, have a good day!" Like. The phone operater would be fired for something like that, even legal actions taken if it were to result in someones death or injury, or putting someone in harm's way. This actually makes me pretty mad, like, do these kids have any idea how shit like this works?! How about before making a GLMM you at the very least research the topic. (Sorry if I seem heated but oh my...)

I remember sitting down, and looking at the loading screens for the hidden battlestar for hourssssss. Confused as all hell, I would try and find every one. I remember finding some by accident as I was just exploring and goofing around. I would play with my squad... sadly none of them play anymore. I remember in season 3 that's all I heard around school. "Hey, Kuteis! Have you heard of Fortnite? It's like, really really fun, you absolutely need to try it!". So I went home that day, downloaded the game.. I was very confused at first, since I hadn't really played much online shooters before, but it was so different that CoD.. more vibrant, and pretty! It mechanically worked different, and I fell in love! I played on occasions, not religiously.. But i still enjoyed playing when I did! Around season 7 my friends started quitting... saying the game was boring now, and lost interest. Well, when season 6 hit.. I was determined! I had purchased my first battlepass, and off on my journey I went! I still play, and I still find this game enjoyable... i wish my friends thought the same (Sorry this is so damn long lmao, just thought I'd share my fond memories :) )
*Looks over in Skye, Talus, and Maeve*

When the whole team has illuminate it really sucks. I always check the scoreboard to know who I can be sneaky around and who I can't. I usually play Skye on more enclosed maps where other champions I enjoy playing struggle, like I do love playing Maeve on Timber Mill, BrightMarsh, and Serpent Beach, because the map suits her. I play Talus on Shattered Desert and Bazaar usually, but I really hate his Ult if I'm not using it for a sniper. I tend to just not use it if there's nobody to use it on.
Using life exchange, the shatter heals the target for 700. Don't want to sound rude just clarifying sorry!

While I understand your point, people do crash during any time of the match. Beginning, during, or even when it's almost over. If you play controller ranked, from my experience Nintendo Switch players crash the most. It wasn't always like this, it has nothing to do with connection either, it's a game error causing the game to close. Trust me, I know. Just earlier today I crashed when it was 3/3 and we ended up losing because of it, which really sucks because it's not like I was mad and chose to leave. I'm not trying to be rude, I sincerely hope I don't come off that way. If you're on PC however, I don't know anything about how that works, I do know it can crash... But maybe it's not as often as other systems.

Ren is crying laughing on the floor... why? Everyone else is like, snickering at the thought of this Rin girl 'pranking' her 'husband' into thinking she committed suicide. That's not funny in the slightest, suicide shouldn't be a hilarious concept in this scenario... imagine the husband, coming home from work I'll assume, opening the bedroom door to see his wife, motionless on the ground with her eyes shut, and a note beside her. He would shakenly take the note, unfold it, and read aloud something along the lines of "I just can't take this anymore, you were the best I had... and I'm sorry I had to do this to you -------" so on. He would obviously be devastated, then out of the blue. She just sits up and yells "Haha! You fell for that?!" While laughing, all her friends/family come out of hiding and laugh along with her. This is funny....how..?

I play Maeve a decent amount, and I absolutely hate Street Justice. I prefer Cat Burglar, because not only the damage buff, I don't need to rely on a pretty good movement ability for a kill. I rarely use pounce to secure a kill or even for damage, mainly I use it for dashing above their heads and flicking around for a shot in the middle of a fight, otherwise I will use pounce to get up to higher places. Also, pounce' s base damage is 400, basically one dagger shot. With Street Justice it does the base 400 sure, but when the target is below the 35% health it'll do literally up to 1500-ish on a Tank. You even get this skull indicater showing you that the target is ready to be executed, your kda will look pretty killer I mean... 24/3/16 in a 15 minute match? That's ballistic! But the only way you got your kills was just finishing off the poor Terminus on point or the lonely Ying trying to take cover. While relying on that pounce for a garunteed kill, you aren't really gonna use it for mobility, which can really limit you to being just near ground most of the time, where you could easily be gunned down due to Maeve base health being a base of 1900, you could add to your survivability by adding the Street Cred loadout card to 5 for a max of 2150 health. Personally I don't find dishing 4 points into a health card is that great though, when easily Persistence or something like Walk It Off are just better to put some points into. Not sure if this is really what everyone's looking for, I feel like some of this might be my personal opinion.. But from someone with a decent amount of time on Maeve, Street Justice is not the talent to go for.
It's a BattlePass Team Booster, the Jenos on your team activated on for the whole team. It increases your teams BattlePass experience by 20% for the duration of the match

I hate when people insert their oc's into the creepypasta universe, and they're 10 #215; stronger than all the existing creepypastas. I'm fine with people having a creepypasta oc, but it's always a MarySue! They are the strongest, fastest, and most agile of everybody. And of course all the creepypastas love the oc, and nobody hates them. Of course these are just kids but I do think they could learn a thing or two about proper oc creation...
I get this every other match, sucks when I'm on Maeve ;(

Omg, I solo queue Seige and it's a nightmare. I'll have in mind what roles I'm willing to play, either Flank or Support, but I'm a mediocre Tank. Anyways, the match starts.. and I have my team, for example the map is Serpent Beach, which is my favorite Maeve map, so I tap on Maeve real quick to show people that's who I want to play. Then, all of a sudden a Zhin or Skye (seems to be most common on my end) below level 5 immediately lock. Like, they obviously see I want to play flank, and choose flank. So then, now I'm annoyed I pick a healer, and wait to see what everyone else will play. Well now we have a Flank, 3 Damage, and me... on support. So I reluctantly lock in whatever support I'm playing that time and it starts. The loading screen usually looks something like this: My team: Zhin: Level 5 Viktor: Level 20 Tyra: Level 7 Vivian: Level 3 Ying: Level 40 (Or someone else I'll stick with my girl Ying ^-^) Enemy Team: Androxus: Level 25 Inara: Level 20 Drogoz: Level 45 Seris: Level 30 Evie: Level 35 So, this isn't exactly what the teams look like.. this is supposed to be a visual for what I get vs what I'm against... it's always a 0-4 stomp, and at then end all the dps on my team blame me for losing, when none of them played a needed role, or even played the role they chose well. I'll get a good amount of healing, but that's just not enough for us to win.. I actually love playing on even teams where everyone's champ is around level 25-30, because then the match is long and worthwhile.. not just an 0-4 or 4-0 stomp. And later, after the match is over I'll see that by looking up the match id on Paladins Guru, I'll see that either the entire enemy team is a 5 stack, or the entire enemy team is level 200+ while my teamates are always 60-80, 100 if I'm lucky (I'm level 128 I believe, close to 130). I feel like I don't play half bad, but I keep getting these teamates that are all for themselves! Sorry if I'm just complaining but, it's so hard for me to enjoy playing when my team is under skilled compared to the other, and i don't want to sound like I'm saying "Well I'm the best and everyone else is just garbage", that's not what I'm trying to say.. But seriously, stop matching me against a team that is 10 #215; better than mine. Anyone have ideas for what I can do as a solo queue?
I believe it's different for ranked, then again I don't play ranked often but as a switch casual player, who gets dc'd a lot, it's always 2 mins on casual. Correct me if I'm wrong please

Yeah, besides the crashing every other game.. or during my first game on... or at a really intense part of a match.. or, you get it. I do lag alot some days, but I'm aware that it's my connection, sometimes you just need to reset the router and it'll run decently for the most part

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you for making the healers job slightly easier. Trust me, when I play healer I hate having to chase our flank across the map while they're spamming "Need Healing!". When I play flank I give myself a decent amount of self sustain because I don't want to upset our healer ;w;
Mine took about 5 mins total, at first it showed 45 mins and my eyes rolled into the back of my head till I saw it go down
Is anyone going to point out her chest is facing forward, while the rest of her body is looking towards the right? Not only is the message just wierd, the editing isn't proportional

An Au is an alternative universe. Basically there was a character that is very happy, and helpful.. in an alternate universe you change the characteristics of someone. So now this person in the main universe, is happy and helpful, in an alternate universe they are angsty, and rude. That's kinda the whole Undertale fandom, you could say. The main Au being Undertale, but the alternates being ones like Underswap, and Underfell. It takes the same characters, and changes the characteristics of them. You could even say an Au has different types of creatures or terrain unusual to our own! But what I hate in this post about the response "Its just her au", is you shouldn't really be able to take a real condition/disease and change it's effects, then go around and say "Well it's my Au I'm allowed to do anything I want with it!" While you wouldn't be wrong, it is your Au and you are allowed to do anything you desire to it, it's insensitive to so something like this. Hope you understand, I did go off on some wierd tangent but still ;^;
No problem! I do hope it helped ^-^
Bro are you ok-?

Ah yes, the fabled Cardio Viktor. I have my own nickname for these folk... "Runny Healy Man" I say, as he sprints into the distance, me In hot pursuit. Lol, I know the pain of not having someone want to play support. I'm a flank main, but I also enjoy playing healer. I have a personal goal to try and master all healers at some point, so I can use the right healer for each map/team comp. So far I have been able to execute a good Ying, Seris, and Medicocre Io. Working on Corvus, and Furia currently.

Whenever I play Talus I put it behind Pillars and around corners. It does usually get found if a Flanker comes by, but I feel like that's just a drawback of Playing Talus. His Rune literally glows, sometimes it's hard to not miss it. Sometimes I do understand, you just want to place it and get on with what you're doing, but personally I feel at the beginning of each round, or after you redrawn you should take an extra second to play it carefully. Just my opinion, but trust me, I also find it quite annoying when someone camps the rune

I absolutely hate SJ, I hate how little effort it put into killing things, I hate the little fail safe for if your aim isn't too good, as long as the enemy is low you'll kill them. I prefer Cat Burglar over Street Juctice any day. I do want to learn Rouges Gambit, because it seems fun for hyper mobility though. Also, I just hate the playstyle of SJ, it's just killstealing honestly. I have a friend who "mains" Maeve and only uses Street Juctice because they think the talent is great. I really hate it, I want to be able to curb them away from that damn talent because of how little effort you need to do well with it
Yeah I'm having this bug as well, I want to equip the emotes, but I'm unable to. I'm able to equip poses, just not the emotes although I buy them :/

I feel this, so damn much. Basically one match I'll be against literal Masters... and my Team will be full of newer-ish players. The next match or so after I'm now dominating with a similar skill team (Or i get hard carried lol). And the enemy team will be full of newer players, with maybe a high skilled player paired with them. It's especially frustrating when I'm playing healer, but my team overall isn't too great, and even though i'm healing them, they're making stupid plays resulting in them dying. And then they just spam "Need Healing!" In VGS when they're pushed up way to far, and not capping point. Or they blame the loss on "The Ying that was worse than a bot" when I come out on top with healing, and people on my team with low-ish amounts of deaths. Trust me, we all feel it man ;-;
So far, after this patch my Inara notifications are adding after each match, so far I'm up to about 64

We could totally play! I play on Switch tho, not exactly the same but still. What server you play on? I play NA, also we can play training to maybe get you used to all the classes, and you could tell me what champs you currently like! ^-^

I feel like he's lower skill. Kinda like a "low risk, high reward". But, I ask my friend, who doesn't play flanks what their thoughts were on Talus, and they said the Rune was confusing (They're a tank/support main). So I do feel like you need to understand a couple things while playing him, such as- When to leave a fight When/How to use Blitz Upper And maybe where you're supposed to place a rune I still stand by my statement, he is by no means high skill, but depending on person to person the difficulty playing him can differ.

In bot matches, I'll usually be playing someone I don't really know well. And a new player will be there (Viktor or Lex 99% of the time), and it's usually a kid on Mic saying this like "Omg I'm so good at this game!!!" After getting a double kill or something lol. I'll come onto the Mic and support them, but I try to ease into the hard truth that this game isn't always an easy stomp against the enemy. Every now and then they'll understand, and I'll try to give them tips against champions, and playing with champions... But most of the time they'll start acting toxic to me for no reason. Whether it be "Well I play this champ well, and you suck with yours" or "Shut up woman" (._.). I try to be friendly to them, but sometimes I'm in a pretty bad mood so i try to stay quiet
Sweet! You on currently?
13 as well! I sound older though, according to literally everyone lmao
We can use discord lol, I'll send you it through the dm on here ^-^

Moooood, I'm in general a bit shaky, just from normal anxiety, and maybe peer pressure to do well... I get so frustrated when someone is on literally no health but I just can't hit them. Also sucks when I crash in-game for no reason in the middle of a huge fight, I actually play on Switch so it's hella frequent. Also, level 97? Good job! I'll get champs to the level one day, but so far I'm happy with what I have :) Oh, and when people are being Toxic that I picked Maeve in the first place, it gets my anxiety up, because I want to do well to show them that Maeve was worth picking lol. I do fill roles, but damn is Maeve fun

I literally cannot express how much i hate this. 1) Why is this a ship, Draco is a Death Eater few 2) |Spoilers, look down further| 3) The 3 of them hated Draco from day 1 at Hogwarts 4) Why would Hermionie and Ron even have that stupid, smug look on their faces, I'm assuming this is the Griffindor Dorms so Draco wouldn't even be allowed inside! 5) If the creator even read the damn books or watched the movies they would know these damn things as well |Spoiler| Harry Ends up with Ginny, and they have some kids together, as seen at the End of The Deathly Hallows part 2 movie, and described at the end of The Deathly Hallows book!

I also have Insomnia, and I know what that's like as well. Maybe not to your extent, but still. I'll fall asleep around 6 a.m, and wake up around 9 a.m, but I usually get woken up by our roommate, while she's calling me lazy for sleeping in and such. My parents and I try to explain to her that I have difficulties falling asleep, and staying asleep for a long period of time, but she never listens. I'm also, not on any meds so it's really not great. I can at least be thankful I get around 3-5 hours of sleep a night, and I'm so sorry you barely get 2. Hell, as I'm writing this the clock will turn 5 a.m soon.

I'm emotionless, therefore I feel only negative emotions. Ah yes, this makes total sense! My character will not be able to feel happy, however... so they must kill people... Yes yes, it's all coming together! Now we must work on the design... hm, Red Gucci bracelets! What a classic! Every good edgy character needs these! Hm, for the outfit.. we need all black, just to show I'm serious about being sad and angry all the time. Yes, now the species... ah, demon, obviously. I would be an idiot not to make such a wonderful edgy character a demon! All jokes aside, this genuinely makes so little sense. If they wanted such a cringey, edgy character they should've just stuck with that as the personality, instead saying they're emotionless, but feel anger and sadness.

You need to go to the bottom area, where the rug is. And play Zeldas Lullaby to gain access to the door, inside is Darunia, you need to talk to him, he's in a bad mood so you'll need to play Saria's Song to calm him down. If you don't have Saria's Song you need to go back to Kokiri Forest and enter the Lost Woods, follow the tunnels on which has the music playing the loudest. You'll enter into the Sacred Meadows where you'll need to go through this Maze-Like puzzle to find Saria. After you talk to Saria, agree to play the Ocarina with her, she'll teach you the song and you can go back to Goron City and play it for Darunia. I hope this helped at all, I'm not very good at explaining things

I'm technically not done with my first play through actually! I recently got Ocarina Of Time 3D for my 3DS, but I wanted to keep gameplay as authentic as possible. So I don't look up the guides, I actually left Goron City somewhat recently, and now I'm in Zoro's Domain. I'm still trying to figure out how to get inside Jabu Jabu, but it's a work in progress!

WRITING.TITLE: Why didn't you tell us BEFORE everyone decided? (This was a couple weeks ago, but I just remembered I took a screenshot)

WRITING.TEXT: I was shocked as well, usually they just lock whoever whenever. Gets on my nerves but whatever I guess

I don't want to come off as rude, apologies if i do.. This was casual, which is casual there isn't much of a reason to get upset over something like this, it just happens way to often.. also they were last pick, I don't usually lock until there is 5-10 seconds left and the other people haven't chosen. I chose Seris since we needed a healer, and everyone else besides Skye had already locked. The Skye player never showed who they wanted to pick, otherwise I might've been playing Tank to fill the role. They had chosen last second with no indication on who. Again I understand this is just casual, and this happens.. also I really do apologise if I come of as rude

I do kind of want to blame either Viv or Maeve honestly, they should've at least not instalocked. The Skye picked last, with no indication on who they wanted to play, so since we didn't have a healer locked in, I picked Seris. I do appreciate that they stated they were a bad tank, but they did so after everyone had already selected.. it is just casuals, so I can't be too upset about it, but it still is just a pain in the side some days.. Apologies if I come off as rude
This was weeks ago, if I remember correctly we lost sadly:(

I believe he waited a total of 5 seconds before he decided he'll be playing Vik lol. I actually wanted to play flank as per usual, but since we already had Maeve and Vivian I went with support since I feel comfortable on support. I really wished that when I leveled up higher I'd be set apart from people who Instalock, but alas matchmaking doesn't work that way. I'm currently level 172 and still experience this stuff lmao, it probably doesn't matter but oh boy...I sometimes go a week or two without seeing even levelings in my team matchups. I just hate when I'm paired with all the level 40-50's against level 150-300's ._.

I've had that almost all night, I'm no longer enjoying my anger. Since I've leveled up, I thought I wouldn't be dealing with this anymore... I also hate when they criticize me for playing (insert champ) because they require less skill then the one they're playing. I remember a time when someone was mad I chose Ying for a healer instead of someone like Seris or Io..

I feel this way so often, I sometimes question why I fill roles and pick around what my teamates are. Of course the answer is "you have a better chance at winning", and "it's the right thing to do" but... if I want to play Maeve on Serpent Beach for example, I will click on her to show my team who I want to play, then I wait. Well now we have a Skye, Zhin, Corvus, and Viktor.. even though I had technically chosen first, I'm almost never taken into consideration when they lock. Usually in that circumstance I have a choice, play my tank of choice, or continue with Maeve and be the 3rd flank your team doesn't need. If I go with the tank option, usually what happens is I get 0 heals the entire match, and just suffer while trying to hold point. I seriously wish my teamates would be more cooperative, and work with me instead of against me...

This. I do the same thing, I can play around 10 champs decently (Woo, what a big number), but I always try to show who I want to play, so my team can pick accordingly. The Skye in this picture never showed who they wanted, the entire time. And Sadly this was Siege, Stone Keep to be exact... I also want to believe that they think they're being helpful by just waiting, and not clicking anyone, but it really is harmful as you mentioned... we need to know who you want to play, so we can pick accordingly!
For the first few I couldn't even figure out what I was looking at-

WRITING.TITLE: Forgot about this gem I found about a week ago

WRITING.TEXT: Quick PSA, on the PAGO app you cannot search by name, only by user id, which I have covered. There could be many people with the same name, but nobody has the same user id
It's called PAGO, I did a little PSA in my comment to let people know
No problem, just trying to make people aware they can't search the name shown and find this person. They need the user id which is hidden
Wow, were you actually able to find that match in my archives? You must've seen so many shitty games in between lol
Is that fucking RosyClozy? Are you kidding me?
Everyone kinda follows every on PAGO lol, you're fine. Also We're the same age as well, all of us are just stupid 13 year olds ;w;
Pretty wild lol, I like to try and find the chat rooms with people that are taking turns singing to help boost my confidence and not make me so nervous in front of others
I absolutely hate Ice Mines, also Warders Gate. Bazaar, personally isn't too bad but not my favorite, and Timber Mill is just stupid if I'm not playing Maeve.
Personally when I play Ying it feels so good to outheal the one person on my team who chose a secondary healer, because they thought I wouldn't heal. By a large margin as well

I remember I was playing Maeve against a Skye that was absolutely fragging. I was the only one to buy Illuminate. Another time I was playing Ying against a Skye (common on console), and yet again I was the only one to buy Illuminate! Our DPS would be whining in chat about the Skye, but wouldn't bother to get illuminate. I wish people that don't believe in those type of items could just be paired against Skyes, Sha Lins, and Strix Mains til' they learn

I'm kinda a Skye/Maeve main lol. Skye- Main Talent: Debilitate Usually I would play Skye on maps like; Magistrates Archives, Jaguar Falls, Primal Court, Stone Keep (Rarely), and Frog Isle (Rarely) I also love using Smoke and Dagger, so I can pick up on heals when I'm 99% sure our healer will be oblivious. Maeve- Main Talent: Cat Burglar Usually I would play Maeve on maps like; Serpent Beach, Stone Keep, Marauders Port, Frog Isle, BrightMarsh, and Timber Mill Maeve is really fun to play imo, but can be a little difficult if you don't understand that you don't need to use Nine Lives every single time you're out of cooldowns lol. Serpent Beach is by far my favorite map for her, I prefer going to the upper side, and figuring out what I'll do from there. Mainly what I ask myself when playing Maeve is; Where is the healer? Where is the backline DPS situated? Can I help kill the tank if they're low? Can I help fight off the other flanks going towards out healer because nobody seems to give a shit if our healer is alive or not, and then blame them that we lost because the healer went 1/15/8 because the GM Androxus was targeting them the whole game. (Ahem) Can I help make callouts on enemy position? Probably not that helpful honestly, if anyone's interested I can show you my loudouts, With Maeve personally I have quite a lot of self sustain
I rarely see a Grover ;-; When I do they're on the enemy team most likely.. kinda sucks because I like Grover as a healer, but oh boy I just suck with him
And you still lost, damn that sucks
I learned that the hard way lmao, at first I had no idea
We're both incredibly fucked lmao
Don't encourage them

Personal opinion, use Cat Burglar, Maeve works well on maps like Serpent Beach, Timber Mill, Stone Keep, etc. My personal loudout is; Predation 5 Walk It Off 5 Savagery 3 Chase 1 Scamper 1 In my personal opinion it provides enough self sustain to not rely on healers tailgating you (which they shouldn't) Each dagger seems to feel different when you throw them, I feel like Demonette Maeves feel really good to throw, but sadly I don't own them ;(
What message app is that called? Looks neat
Yeah same, I run average of 100-150. Today is just a really bad day :/
I can't even explain how many times this has happened, with the exact same expression lmao. What makes the blow kinda worse is I'm on switch ;-;
I've gotten that to work lol. Specially since Maeve is so small it can make her harder to hit while she's just running around the point like a madman trying to hold overtime
We don't, when I logged on my laptop I had the option even though I was already level 130 at the time
Luke looks similar to an UwU Femboy, and the other guys are like OwO Badboys.. why the stereotypes..?
Take my upvote and politely fuck off (Sorry for sounding rude ;w;)

WRITING.TITLE: I wasn't sure if I would be allowed to rant on r/Paladins ... so i decided I may as well here (in comments, if you're somehow here within the first minutes of me posting you probably won't see it)

WRITING.TEXT: So basically, the Zhin and Dredge left beginning of the match for seemingly no reason. If it was a crash I wouldn't have brought it to anyone's attention. But I'm actually a bit heated from this. Ok, so. Dredge wasn't connecting in very beginning, so I was like "Ok no biggie, 4v5 isn't too bad". Zhin had loaded in (I'm pretty sure), but he never picked a talent and just had left. Like straight up left... so now it's a 3v5 with a Focusing Lense solo healer Ying. Are you serious. Ok no problem, we have a tank I guess... so I'm trying to do my normal Maeve things, but it's difficult because we're 3v5. I did die alot, I won't deny that... But let me finish ranting please. So, now I feel like a 1v5. I feel like a one man team. Well, I've been losing quite a bit today, due to selfish teamates or just idiots. Everyone on either team was under level 50. My account level is currently 176, now I'm not sure how everything is rated, but this doesn't sound right. I felt like no matter what I'm doing it's just not working, I hate that I feel like I always need to be the bigger person.... and be nice, but it's hard sometimes for me to feel positive, and try to see the light in every dark situation... I also seem to have pretty bad matchmaking even if I'm with one friend, our team just seems to be uncoordinated, or pick stupid champions on maps where they won't perform too well at all. Sorry if this sounds like I'm bitching about things that don't really matter, but I just feel at such a loss.

I take mental breaks often with this game, it's just so stressful even though I don't play the competitive mode. Actually, about 30 mins after this game, I was able to get back with my friend, and we played a siege, sadly on Warders Gate which is a map we both hate. I couldn't stop myself from laughing and just smiling! I played Maeve yet again (I swear I'm a masochist, I enjoy my pain). And the enemy had 3 healers, I went for jenos the most, and I would say stupid shit whenever I was coming up to him "Guess Who's back.. back again, Maeve is back, to kill your friends!" It's so cheesy, but I seriously couldn't help but smile and laugh. I just needed someone right there with me, because if I solo queue for so long I basically go insane lol. Oh, and at one point in the match for some odd reason I kept getting finishing blows on everyone, so I just like, yelled "BIITTTTCHHH" out loud for each person I finished lmao. I don't really care if all that sounds dumb, but my friend and I were smiling
Yes but, you left my only true love- Rainbow Rentals :D
You did great don't sweat it lol

I thought they just needed to be level 5 to stop being paired with bots, and then levels 5-29 are paired together, and levels 30+ are paired together

WRITING.TITLE: Help For A Friend
WRITING.TEXT: So, my friend is a supposed "Maeve Main". He's hardstruck on her, but the problem is he runs street Juctice. I also play Maeve, but I have tons more hours on her than he does... I personally believe his loudout is atrocious but he won't listen, I also tell him not to play Street Juctice, he won't listen. How do I help steer him away from that talent? I would rather he play Cat Burglar, but it's his choice. Here's his loudout if anyone would be wondering Fight or Flight 3 Patch up 1 Cut and Run 5 Predation 2 Street Cred 4 Personally, I hate how cut and Run is at 5, like who needs that at 5. I've tried his loudout in training with the same talent, and I find it hard to play with that crazy speed boost which is highly unessicary, along with for street Juctice, even if he were to sadly keep playing the talent, he has no damage reduction on pounce, which I feel like is one of her main cards for street Juctice. I need help guys, any suggestion on how I should go about telling him the way he's playing isn't the best..?

Yeah good luck indeed, he just doesn't want to listen to what I say about talents and such. And I guess it does sound like I am just telling him to play a certain way.. also he does think he knows everything about Maeve as well, like it's kinda ridiculous. And I guess he's trying to be helpful when he's telling me things about her I already know, but then he acts like an asshole when I tell him i already knew certain things. What's also hard is he's basically one trick Maeve, he has barely any clue how to play anyone else, I try to tell him on certain maps, like the more close quarters ones, that Maeve probably isn't the best choice here, he'll just tell me I don't know what I'm talking about. I also remember couple months back he challenged me to a Maeve 1v1, where we go through all the talents, starting with Cat Burglar, Street Juctice, then Rouges Gambit. It was 5 - 0 and he decided to quit right there, he wouldn't listen to any advice I gave and just kept doing what he was doing. I also feel like he just isn't really mechanically there ya know? He won't use pounce for movement, only rarely if with prowl he won't be able to reach somewhere. What I learned as well is he struggles with hitting moving targets, when we were fighting eachother I could see he was barely hitting me. I guess this may just be a rant, but you're right I can try and send guides his way and see if he listens :)

Yeah lol, when we were messaging about him re down loading the game (he keeps deleting, staying off for 2 months, then coming back), he said there's one rule "you are to not play maeve unless i approve it when were playing" That is exactly what he wrote, like??? I was confused about it, in my head I'm just thinking.. Dude you have 9 hours on her total.. I have 51 hours, why do you get to tell me when I'm allowed to play her???
F
Can we appreciate that this is slightly darker than a normal screenshot post? It makes it easy on the eyes :)
"Adios"
I just prefer to say "The air smells like a barbeque" lol

I don't see this as sexualizing the MLP series which I do in Gacha Life Cringe frequently which is actually quite disturbing... anyways this is probably a child between the ages 8-11, which is my best guess. And they're just making fan content for a show they may enjoy. I believe that was an episode of the show actually, but I don't remember too well I haven't watched MLP since like 2014 lol. Anyways like I said, personally this doesn't qualify as cringe, but I guess I could understand why you think it does
